conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the sliders to find the magnitude of the external force F.
Identify the forces acting on the system: gravitational force mg, normal force N, frictional force f, tension T, and external force F.
Resolve the gravitational force into components parallel (mg sin θ) and perpendicular (mg cos θ) to the inclined plane.
Set up the equilibrium conditions: net force parallel to the inclined plane must be zero.
Calculate the normal force N as N = mg cos θ, which equals 0.8mg.
Calculate the frictional force f as f = μN, which equals 0.4mg.
Set up the equilibrium condition parallel to the inclined plane: F cos θ - T - mg sin θ - f = 0.
Substitute known values into the equilibrium condition: F × 0.8 - T - mg × 0.6 - 0.4mg = 0.
Simplify the equation to 0.8F - T - mg = 0.
Consider the tension T in the rope, which balances the forces acting on slider A.
Calculate tension T as T = mg sin θ + f = 1.0mg.
Substitute T back into the equilibrium equation: 0.8F - 1.0mg - mg = 0.
The magnitude of the external force F is 2.5mg.
